abstract.t: Virtual private networks are becoming a common offering of manyservice providers. There are many technologies with which toimplement a VPN service, ranging from MPLS to GRE to IPSEC. Acommon requirement of all VPN technologies is the need to discoverall of the sites, or at least all the provider equipment associatedwith the sites, that are in a particular VPN. DNS provides asimple and commonly available mechanism for site discovery that isindependent of any signaling or tunneling protocol. This draftproposes the use of DNS as a discovery mechanism for VPN maintenanceand control.
